title: BBC Local Live: Merseyside on Monday 25 April 2016 - BBC News
summary: demolition of two 15-storey tower blocks fails , leaving nearby residents unable to return home .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tuesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates from west cheshire and merseyside have finished for the day , but we 'll be back from 08:00 on tuesday to bring you the latest from the hillsborough inquests as the conclusions into how 96 football fans were fatally injured in the 1989 disaster are revealed .

documents.title: weather : temperatures set to drop tomorrow
text: if you think it 's chilly today , here 's a look at tuesday 's windchill temps # brrrrrr nick

documents.title: southport man jailed for distributing indecent images of children
text: a southport man who downloaded and distributed almost 2,000 child porn images has been jailed for 20 months .
author: Southport Visiter

documents.title: police search for wirral man following assault
text: merseyside police are trying to trace a man who may have information about an assault .

detectives believe 40-year-old lee jason stewart , whose last known address was arrowe park road , upton , wirral , could have vital information following an assault on st oswalds avenue , beechwood , wirral on saturday .

documents.title: families spend second night in hotel following failure of tower block demolition
text: a number of residents in sefton are preparing to spend a second night away from their homes after the demolition of a nearby 15-storey tower block failed .
montgomery house in seaforth should have been levelled yesterday , along with churchill house - but it 's still standing despite a corner of the building collapsing this afternoon .

documents.title: latest headlines in merseyside and west cheshire
text: today 's top stories in merseyside and west cheshire :

documents.title: everton fundraiser 'speedo mick ' smashes 50k milestone
text: a football fan who walked to wembley wearing his swimming trunks has broken his £ 50,000 fundraising target .
everton supporter michael cullen , 50 , completed the 11-day challenge ahead of his team 's fa cup semi-final against manchester united on saturday .
he has now raised more than £ 53,000 for the woodlands hos in liverpool , having previously raised £ 30,000 after swimming the english channel .

documents.title: toxteth chaplin 's pub owner admits £ 350,000 tax evasion and benefits fraud
text: the owner of a toxteth pub admitted tax evasion of nearly £ 350,000 at liverpool crown court .
author: Liverpool Echo

documents.title: maghull nursery faces no further action over child assault allegation
text: a nursery that was being investigated by police over alleged assaults on a child in merseyside faces no further action .
officers examined an allegation of `` a small number of assaults '' at it 's the little things children 's day nursery in maghull in november 2015 .

documents.title: seaforth tower block still standing after second demolition attempt
text: a 15 storey block of flats in seaforth is still partially standing after a second attempt to demolish it today .

documents.title: police investigate fight between everton and manchester united fans
text: merseyside and greater manchester police are to look at mobile phone footage of a fight between everton and manchester united fans at a service station .
it happened before the fa cup semi final on saturday at cannock chase services , but when local police arrived supporters had already left .
the brawl was captured on and put on social media .

documents.title: football : danny ings verdict imminent
text: liverpool and burnley will find out what the transfer fee for striker danny ings will be at a tribunal in manchester on tuesday .
ings left burnley at the end of last season after his contract had expired .
because the striker was under 24 , the club were allowed compensation for his development .
however , there was no agreement between the two clubs , with burnley wanting in excess of £ 10m and liverpool offering less than £ 6m .
more from bbc sportsday
author: Simon Stone
BBC Sport

documents.title: up to 100 syrian refugees to be resettled in wirral
text: wirral council has confirmed plans to welcome 100 syrian refugees over the next four years .
author: Wirral Globe

documents.title: mayoral debate : listen again to liverpool candidates
text: the seven candidates who want to be the next mayor of liverpool have taken part in a live debate on bbc radio merseyside this lunchtime .
roger phillips chaired the hour-long programme , where the candidates answered questions from radio merseyside listeners and readers of the liverpool echo .
the candidates are :
listen again to the liverpool mayoral debate

text: today 's top stories in merseyside and west cheshire :

documents.title: travel : neston road blocked due to accident
text: neston road in neston , cheshire is blocked and there is slow traffic in both directions at the mill lane junction because of an accident .
more from bbc travel
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: chester cathedral marks one year into lego scale model build
text: chester cathedral in lego is celebrating one year into a project to recreate the building in lego bricks .
a year in - 35,000 bricks have been added - nearly completing the first level of the model .
when finished , the scale model will be made up of 350,000 individual bricks and feature both the ancient cathedral and grounds .
funds raised by the project directly fund the chester cathedral education trust , working to secure the employment of a full-time education officer .

documents.title: police hunt man accused of throwing his dog against a wall
text: police are hunting for a man who is alleged to have thrown his dog against a wall at his home in southport .
author: Southport Visiter

documents.title: mayoral debate : potholes top talking point between candidates
text: all seven candidates who want to be the next mayor of liverpool have been taking part in a live debate on bbc radio merseyside this lunchtime - and inevitably the discussion turned to potholes

documents.title: families still ca n't return home after failed seaforth flats demolition
text: some families in seaforth still ca n't return to their homes after the planned demolition of two 15-storey tower blocks nearby failed .
two attempts to bring churchill house and montgomery house down were made on sunday .
one vision housing said : `` we are currently working with our demolition contractor to ensure that the controlled collapse of montgomery house is carried out safely and as quickly as possible .
`` affected residents have been provided with hotel accommodation , and our staff will be onsite throughout the day to answer any queries they have . ''

documents.title: police reassure haydock community after social media speculation over missing child
text: police say they are carrying out an investigation following claims of a `` sus incident '' in a haydock park - but officers say they have not received any reports of a missing child .
author: St Helens Star

documents.title: hillsborough inquests verdict to be delivered on tuesday
text: the verdicts in the hillsborough inquests will be delivered on tuesday , april 26 .
the court reconvened in warrington this afternoon to be told the jury had reached a verdict .
author: Liverpool Echo

documents.title: hillsborough inquests : what we know
text: after hearing evidence for two years , the jury in the new hillsborough inquests has reached its verdict .
jurors were told they could return a majority decision on whether the victims of the hillsborough disaster were unlawfully killed , after they failed to reach a unanimous conclusion .
the jury of six women and three men has been deliberating since 6 april this year .
the conclusions will not be revealed until tomorrow morning , to allow time for the families to attend the hearing in warrington .

documents.title: hillsborough inquests : verdicts tomorrow to allow families to travel
text: the conclusions wo n't be revealed until tomorrow to allow hillsborough families to attend the hearing in warrington .
author: Andy Gill
Reporter, BBC North West Tonight

documents.title: breakinghillsborough inquests : jury conclusions will be delivered tomorrow
text: the hillsborough inquest conclusions ( verdicts ) will be delivered tomorrow at 11am
author: Andy Gill
Reporter, BBC North West Tonight

documents.title: weather : here 's the north west weather for the week ahead
text: here 's the north west weather for monday and week ahead

documents.title: lewis dunne shooting : man charged with teenager 's murder
text: a man has been charged with murder after the fatal shooting of a 16-year-old boy in liverpool .
lewis dunne , 16 , was found with a shotgun wound in his back on a towpath near burrows court in eldonian village , vauxhall , on 15 november .
jake culshaw , 25 , of penrith street , birkenhead , wirral , is due to appear at liverpool and knowsley magistrates ' court on tuesday .

documents.title: 'world class ' alder hey scoops top awards at property 'oscars '
text: liverpool 's new alder hey hospital scooped three awards for its world class '' design at the the regional property 2016 rics north west awards .
author: Liverpool Echo

documents.title: hillsborough inquests : jury given unlawful killing majority direction
text: jurors have been told they can return a majority decision on whether the 96 victims of the hillsborough disaster were unlawfully killed .
the jury of six women and three men have been deliberating since 6 april after hearing evidence for two years .

documents.title: section of chester city walls closed for repairs
text: a section of chester 's historic city walls are closed for work to repair and rebuild steps at northgate .
author: Chester Chronicle

documents.title: lewis dunne shooting : man , 25 , re-arrested on sus of murder
text: a 25-year-old man from birkenhead has been re-arrested on sus of the murder of 16-year-old lewis dunne in november 2015 .
he died from a single shotgun wound to the back .
the teenager was found on a towpath near burrows court in vauxhall , liverpool , and was taken to hospital where he died .
following the shooting , police searched the canal and recovered items including mobile phones and jackets .

documents.title: hillsborough inquests : seven of nine must agree on unlawful killing question
text: the coroner at the hillsborough inquests has told the jury he will accept a majority decision on the question of whether the 96 who died in the disaster were unlawfully killed .
sir john goldring said he would accept a decision in which at least seven agree and no more than two of the jury disagree .
the jury has been deliberating for nine full days since retiring on 6 april .
the jurors are filling in a 14-section questionnaire , which asks if various factors contributed to the disaster on 15 april 1989 .
they have reached unanimous conclusions for 13 of the questions but have not been able to decide on an answer to question six , which asks if the 96 were unlawfully killed .
author: Ben Schofield
Hillsborough reporter, BBC Radio Merseyside

documents.title: breakinghillsborough inquests : coroner will accept majority verdict on unlawful killing question
text: i 'm at the new hillsborough inquests in warrington where the coroner has told jury he will accept a majority decision on the question on whether the 96 were unlawfully killed .
author: Andy Gill
Reporter, BBC North West Tonight

documents.title: lewis dunne : 25-year-old due in court charged with murder
text: jake michael culshaw , 25 , to appear at liverpool mags tomorrow charged with murder of lewis dunne , 16 , in november

documents.title: breakingman , 25 , re-arrested over lewis dunne murder
text: a 25-year-old man has been re-arrested on sus of the murder of 16-year-old lewis dunne in november 2015 .
jake michael culshaw of penrith street , birkenhead , will appear at liverpool and knowsley magistrates court tomorrow .

documents.title: watch : explosives fail to bring down seaforth tower block
text: the demolition of two towers in seaforth , merseyside does not go according to plan - when only one building collapses .
the vacant high-rise buildings were due to be demolished simultaneously at 10:00 .
but both remained standing after the controlled explosion , before churchill house later collapsed suddenly .

documents.title: travel : failed tower block demolition closes seaforth road
text: claremount road in seaforth is closed in both directions between the a565 crosby road junction and the sandy road junction because of a failed demolition of the seaforth tower blocks .
more from bbc travel
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: campaigning for liverpool city mayor continues
text: campaigning is continuing in liverpool as people decide who they want as the city 's next mayor .
there are seven candidates in total standing in the elections on 5 may .

documents.title: are everton now wigan in disguise ?
text: sport examines roberto martinez 's time at everton and the unfavourable comparisons some pundits are making with his wigan athletic team , who won the fa cup but also suffered relegation from the premier league .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: liverpool community advice centre splits from citizen advice
text: liverpool 's new community advice centre is operating as a stand alone organisation after it split from citizens advice .
managers say staff have transferred to the new organisation in cook street and that it 's offering the same service it always has .

documents.title: watch : 'drunken maniac ' slams bmw into birkenhead tunnel wall in horror crash
text: this is the moment drunken maniac '' ivan rapsys smashed his speeding bmw into the wall of the birkenhead tunnel .
author: Liverpool Echo

text: a5060 chester road in warrington is blocked and there is queuing traffic outbound at the ellesmere road junction near the stag pub because of an accident .

documents.title: demolition of seaforth tower blocks does n't go to plan
text: some families have been forced to spend the night away from their homes in sefton after the demolition of two 15-storey tower blocks failed .
two attempts were made to bring down churchill house and montgomery house in seaforth on sunday .
demolition experts are trying to work out why one of the buildings remains standing .
watch : flats at seaforth collapse .
another block remains standing after a failed demolition .

winds will up this afternoon so it will feel chilly .
highs of 11c .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: hello from liverpool , i 'm here with all your news , sport , travel and weather updates from across merseyside and west cheshire today .
if you 've got a story you 'd like me to hear about or a photograph you 'd like to share , you can contact me on email , facebook or twitter .
author: Jenny Coleman
Reporter, BBC Local Live
